alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 8:33AM CDT until July 11 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Canadian River near Bridgeport affecting Caddo, Blaine, Custer and Canadian Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Canadian River near Bridgeport. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, The river remains within its banks in southern Blaine... northern Caddo... and southwestern Canadian counties. Low-lying bottomlands near the river may be cut off from easy access by high water in side channels. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. The river stage at 7:00 AM CDT Saturday was estimated at 11.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The Canadian River is expected to rise to a crest of 12.3 feet Monday morning. - Action stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM CDT.
